definition: new generation
Cenozoic (geological era covering the last 65m years)
abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
new/newly/meso- (chemistry)
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: The crust of east China has been affected by extensional stress since the Mesozoic-Ceno-zoic.
sentences.chinese: 新生代以来，中国东部地壳一直处在引张应力作用下。

sentences.english: The term "New Generation" refers to the last group of writers in the late 20 th century Chinese literature.
sentences.chinese: 新生代是二十世纪末中国文坛最后一个作家群。

sentences.english: The deposit formed in the volcano thermal-spring geothermal environments in Cenozoic.
sentences.chinese: 滇西两河金矿床产于新生代火山温泉地热环境中。

sentences.english: From the Cretaceous Period to the Cenozoic Period, the volcanism was mainly related to the rifting;
sentences.chinese: 从白垩纪至新生代，火山作用主要与裂谷作用有关。

sentences.english: There are at least nine physiographic cycles in the middle reaches of the Yellow River during the Late Cenozoic Era.
sentences.chinese: 在晚新生代黄河中游至少存在九个地文期旋回。

sentences.english: In the eastern Kuche Depression, Mesozoic Cretaceous and Cenozoic Tertiary are the main depositis.
sentences.chinese: 库车坳陷东部中新生代地层主要发育白垩系和第三系。

sentences.english: Indeed, Bai is a part of a emerging new trend of younger officials in China.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，白一彤正是中国新生代官员的代表。

sentences.english: Yanqi basin is a coal bearing basin in west China.
sentences.chinese: 焉耆盆地是中国西部众多中新生代小型含煤盆地之一。

sentences.english: Li Tie is a really powerful writer of the "new generation".
sentences.chinese: 李铁属于“新生代”实力派作家。

sentences.english: The volcanism is strong in Cenozoic and has several periods.
sentences.chinese: 凹陷中新生代火山作用强烈，也具有多期性。

sentences.english: Taiyuan basin is a representative large-scale Cenozoic rift basin in Shanxi Province, northern China.
sentences.chinese: 山西太原盆地是我国北方典型的大型新生代断陷盆地。

sentences.english: I like to think that this change of environment made them look like next-generation hair curlers.
sentences.chinese: 我想到环境的改变让我看起来像是新生代的卷发家。

sentences.english: Through long terms of tectonic evolutions it changed into a transform fault in the cenozoic era.
sentences.chinese: 经长期构造演化于新生代转变为转换断层。

sentences.english: If scar, local, cainozoic era and so on realism fine arts.
sentences.chinese: 如伤痕，乡土，新生代等等的现实主义美术。

sentences.english: Cultural progress of the new generation inevitably gave rise to the conflict of the secular and refined practices.
sentences.chinese: 随着其新生代的文化进步，必然产生雅俗冲突。

sentences.english: Hailar Basin is a meso-cenozoic of multicycle, composite-style, fault-sag basin.
sentences.chinese: 海拉尔盆地是一个中新生代多旋回复杂叠合盆地。

definition: Mesozoic (geological era 250-65m years ago, covering Triassic 三疊紀|三叠纪, Jurassic 侏羅紀|侏罗纪 and Cretaceous 白堊紀|白垩纪)
new generation
young
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
an up-and-coming youngster/new talent/a brilliant younger generation
cutting-edge (in technology, science, fashion, the arts etc)/novel and competitive/new and dashing
90s generation
well-known figure/excellent (person, company etc)
the present age/the contemporary era
person of outstanding talent
nova (astronomy)
to rise abruptly (to a towering position)/to tower over/to spring up/to emerge suddenly/the emergence (e.g. of a power)
representative individual (of a school of thought)
cream/elite/essence/quintessence
to reveal outstanding talent (idiom); to stand out as conspicuously brilliant
spokesperson
